alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Kingfisher; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:23PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kingfisher, northern Grady, northeastern Caddo, western Oklahoma, northwestern Cleveland, Blaine, western Logan, Canadian and northwestern McClain Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1023 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Loyal to near Calumet to 3 miles southwest of Cogar. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 119 and 145. Interstate 40 between mile markers 95 and 154. Interstate 44 between mile markers 106 and 136. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; Kingfisher; Logan; McClain; Oklahoma
